page.title: 16CAPEL ED CHAPEL GOYTRE
page.content: The chapel was built in 1807. Originally the Coedcae Farm stood on the ground where the chapel is now. Many years before the chapel was built the services were held in the kitchen of the farmhouse. Capel Ed Chapel derived it's name from{Joshua chapter 22 verse 34} "...and the children of Gad called the altar Ed." For the first 70 years there was no organ or piano so all the hymns were sung unaccompanied.At this time one of the chapel stalwarts was John Powell, who lived 4 miles away on the other side of the river Usk. Undeterred by the fact that there was no river crossing he provided himself with a coracle and every Sunday he would paddle his family across.There was a special service to celebrate the chapel's 175th year in 1982.{
